content:
Hello everyone,
I’ve just submitted a PR that defines the unsigned Stirling numbers of the first and second kind via their recurrence relations. I’m not entirely sure if the definitions are fully appropriate or rigorous, so I’d really appreciate any feedback or suggestions. Please feel free to review it and share your thoughts or improvements. Thanks a lot!

You can check the PR here: #26290
@Beibei Xiong Nice work! Just a reminder, definitions should not have underscore, so I would name them stirlingNumSnd or stirlingSnd or stirlingNumberSnd or some variant of those
My preference is stirlingFirst and stirlingSecond, noting that fst and snd already have meaning
docs#Sigma.fst is called like that, instead of Sigma.first so to me stirlingFst is a fine name

I don't understand Yael's comment at all. Sigma.fst is the first component of the two-component object sigma. "Stirling numbers of the first kind" is just a crappy name for a collection of numbers, it's not the first component of stirling pairs-of-numbers.

Yaël Dillies said:

docs#Sigma.fst is called like that, instead of Sigma.first so to me stirlingFst is a fine name

As Kevin says, this is precisely why I think it's a bad name: fst in both Prod and Sigma means the left component of a projection, which is starkly different from what's happening in Stirling

Thanks everyone for your helpful suggestions! I've updated the names to stirlingFirst and stirlingSecond.
I'd really appreciate any further comments or feedback on the PR #26290.:grinning:
You need to update the PR description for the new names.

Kim Morrison said:

You need to update the PR description for the new names.

Thanks! I've updated the PR description to reflect the new names.
Hi all, I’ve finished responding to all the comments on PR #26290 and also made a few small improvements. Just wanted to share an update in case anyone has further suggestions. Thanks a lot!
